meta.title: Write texts to communicate ideas and information
meta.classification: Core Generic > Work and Study Skills
meta.purpose: Learners credited with this unit standard are able to write meaningful texts for different purposes and audiences, and use written language conventions to support communication.

grade_descriptors.N: Evidence does not meet all required Performance Criteria and/or the Outcome 1 range requirements.
grade_descriptors.A: All Performance Criteria across Outcomes 1 and 2 are met AND all Outcome 1 range requirements are satisfied (two texts of different types for different purposes and audiences; at least one formal; at least one continuous text of ≥ 250 word).

outcomes.description: Write meaningful texts for different purposes and audiences.

performance_criteria.description: Select and use content that is appropriate to purpose and audience.
Use text structures in ways that are appropriate to purpose and audience.
Make language choices that are appropriate to purpose and audience (e.g., vocabulary, register, composition of phrases and sentences, tense).
Write text that demonstrates sufficient technical accuracy to communicate meaning, without intrusive errors in spelling, punctuation, or grammar.

outcomes.description: Use written language conventions to support communication.

performance_criteria.description: Construct a variety of complete sentences (simple, compound, complex).
Punctuate correctly to support meaning (capitals, full stops, question marks as required).
Use grammatical conventions within sentences and paragraphs with sufficient technical accuracy to communicate meaning (tense, subject-verb agreement, pronoun reference, word form).
Use and spell everyday high frequency vocabulary with technical accuracy.
Make simple changes to improve text coherence and the organisation of the content.

omis.description: A portfolio/set includes at least two texts.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Two distinct writing samples. ✗ Only one sample.
success_examples: Sample 1: an informal email; Sample 2: a short narrative.

omis.description: The two texts are different text types and for different purposes and audiences.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Different text types/purpose/audience. ✗ Similar type or audience.
success_examples: Text 1: persuasive email to the principal; Text 2: descriptive story for classmates.

omis.description: At least one text uses a formal register.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Formal features like formal greeting or tone.
success_examples: “Dear Sir/Madam, I would like to apply…” — shows formal register.

omis.description: At least one text is a continuous text of ≥ 250 words.
success_examples: A 280-word narrative describing a family holiday, written as one flowing piece.

omis.description: Content is relevant to purpose and audience.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Concrete detail supports purpose; no filler.
success_examples: “the wind was so nice and warm” — sensory detail grounds the text.

omis.detection_hint: ✓ Vivid or descriptive words add clarity.
✓ Consistent informal or formal tone as intended.

omis.description: Spelling, punctuation, grammar accurate with only minor slips.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Meaning clear; errors minimal or non-intrusive.

omis.description: Uses simple, compound, and complex sentences correctly.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Examples of all 3 sentence types present.

omis.description: Uses capitals, full stops, question marks correctly.
Grammar is accurate (tense, subject-verb agreement, pronouns, word form).
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Generally consistent tense and correct pronouns.

omis.description: Everyday high-frequency vocabulary is spelled correctly.
Makes simple edits that improve coherence and organisation.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Use of sequencing words or added cohesion.

aggregation_rules.notes: Award Achieved only if every OMI (including Outcome 1 range OMIs) is met across the writing set.

change_log: Added success examples using student-style excerpts for each OMI.
